div1.p: Morris writes about her brother, Roger Post Ames, and his involvement with the yellow fever experiments. She describes his association with Lazear and his work in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Josephine Ames Morris to Philip Showalter Hench, July 23, 1942

My dear Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
Yours of July 21st to hand &
& contents noted. Yes I have several clippings
of my late brother Dr Roger Post Ames & will
gladly send you by registered mail tomorrow
also- his picture I read in the magazine
called Hygia. of Oct. 1941 - about the Conquerors
of Yellow Fever, & I think it was written by
you. I still have the magazine I would be
pleased to have any article in Yellow Fever.
Several years ago, a Play called Yellow Jack
was staged at the Little Theatre, & I saw
this Play. of course all parties are dead, but
the parts were played by Tulane Professors.
there was Dr. Reed- Dr Finlay Carrol Lazear Ames
& so on well the party who took the part
of Dr. Ames was well played, just like Ames
slow & dignified, the Tulane University sent
me complimentary tickets as Dr Ames was
a Tulane Graduate & Charity Hospital
AmbulanceStudent, he graduated before he
was 21 yr- he was the youngest of his class
& looked the oldest, he had grown, side burns
Now I do know my brother had the yellow fever
while in Cuba. he inoculated himself by letting
the Stegomya bite him & treated himself & I often
heard Dr Ames say that Dr Lazear. was driven down
in Ambulance to his tent to be treated, & get relapse,
it was Dr. Ames who sent his widow all of
his belongings to her & she sent Dr. Lazear
napkin ring back to Dr Ames in Cuba & I still
have the ring, as that time Ames was not married.
Some time ago W. W. L. Loyola University had
a Radio Broadcast on Yellow Fever, & Dr Ames
name was omitted I wrote to the Radio Station
also sent the clipping for them to see that my brother's
name, was one of the Yellow Fever experts-. I
was informed that the books they read Dr. Ames
name was not mentioned, This Dr Gus Lambert
who you mention, should know if Dr Ames lived
at the Camp- My Brother Fred Ames may tell me
more when he comes in town at present he is on
the road. will be in town Friday- as I think Fred
knows- Lambert & I think until him. If Dr. Ames
was living he would be 72y-. he has a son Dr. Frederick W Ames
who is in the Army or Navy- also a daughter Dr Mary Ames
who is a physician in a Hospital in Detroit, Mich
both are Children Specialists, he also has a cripple

daughter, she uses crutches, at 6 yr old she
had infantitis Paraezeres, she is almost 27 yr- born
3 months after the death of Dr Ames. Dr Ames
died of Black Water Fever, & more heart trouble
Mr. White said, I will send you all clippings
& Photo, pertaining to Dr Ames the clipping are some old
& ripe. I may pack them in paper, by reading them
you may get some data, Dr Ames him-self had
a book of all clippings - from all Sen paper Cuba,
N.O. & etc in this Book, but at his death all
his papers - books & estimates & etc were turned over
to his wife, I dont know if she has anything of
his at all. Would be pleased to hear from you
also any writings or magazine, pertaining to Yellow Fever
would be appreciated. Thanking you in Advance
